document_data.name: ''Justice for All''
document_data.author: [[Ada the Unbending]]
document_data.mainbody: '''''Justice for All''''' was a [[book]] of memoirs penned by [[Ada the Unbending]], a [[priestess]], judge, and adventuring [[paladin]] of [[Tyr]] in the mid-14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.History: Ada the Unbending retired to the community called [[Nellie Thursday Home for Experienced Adventurers]] after a life of service to a local temple to Tyr and civic service as a judge for three decades. At the age of sixty-seven, she put down her hammer and picked up a [[quill]]. In her retirement, Ada was working on her memoir – ''Justice for All'', however, it was not known if the book ever saw print.{{Cite polyhedron/72/Experience Preferred, Part One|12}}
